items.headline: Hull FC 12-10 Warrington Wolves

90950372.altText: Hull FC lift the Challenge Cup

items.summary: Hull FC win a Wembley Challenge Cup final for the first time, coming from behind to beat Warrington Wolves 12-10.

items.headline: Wakefield players hurt in car accident

90946938.caption: Wakefield captain Danny Kirmond, 30, was one of three players injured in the accident

items.summary: Wakefield Wildcats players Chris Annakin, Richard Owen and captain Danny Kirmond suffer injuries when their car hit a tree.

items.headline: The moment Hull FC set up Wembley win

90948484.altText: Shaul try and Sneyd goal put Hull in front

37204764.caption: The moment Hull FC set up Wembley win

items.summary: Hull FC's Jamie Shaul touches down under the posts to level the score at 10-10 in the Challenge Cup final against Warrington.

items.headline: Heroic Houghton's match-saving tackle for Hull

90948486.altText: Challenge Cup Final 2016: Incredible match-winning tackle from Danny Houghton

37206797.caption: Heroic Houghton's match-winning tackle for Hull

items.summary: Watch a sensational piece of defensive work from Hull FC's Danny Houghton prevent Ben Currie from scoring a late Challenge Cup-winning try for Warrington.

items.headline: Full-back Tansey released by Wakefield

90942014.altText: Jordan Tansey has not played for Wakefield since kicking three goals in last season's Million Pound Game win over Bradford Bulls

items.summary: Wakefield Trinity Wildcats' much-travelled full-back Jordan Tansey is released by mutual consent.

items.headline: Sinfield appointed RFL rugby director
items.summary: Former Leeds Rhinos and England captain Kevin Sinfield is appointed rugby director at the Rugby Football League.

items.headline: Catalans' Taylor charged twice by RFL
items.summary: Catalans Dragons forward Dave Taylor faces up to a 10-game ban after being charged twice by the Rugby Football League.

items.headline: Featherstone 18-30 Leigh
items.summary: Leigh Centurions edge closer to a Super League return, beating Featherstone to extend their 100% start to the Qualifiers.

items.headline: Widnes 40-8 Wakefield
items.summary: Widnes ease to victory with seven tries against Wakefield, although both sides are unable to reach the top four.

linkedItem.headline: Two bids lead race to buy Bulls

items.quoteSource: RFL director of licensing Blake Solly
items.quoteText: The bid from Super League (Europe) Ltd remains on the table but it is very much a last resort
